Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 060202 ZSM and C 060203 ZSM, special permits, shall be subject to Council review.  These applications are related to application no. N 060201 ZRM that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Special Permits (C060202 ZSM and C060203 ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Fidler:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 2901 Emmons Avenue Community Board 15 Application 20065154 TCK shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 2901 Emmons Avenue, Brooklyn (20065154TCK)

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the Save Darfur Coalition’s “Save Darfur: Rally to Stop Genocide,” and declaring April 30, 2006 to be “Save Darfur Day”
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Supporting the American Jewish World Service’s “Save Darfur: Rally to Stop Genocide,” and declaring April 30, 2006 to be “Save Darfur Day”.

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing The Border Protection, Anti-Terrorism, and Illegal Immigration Control Act of 2005 (HR 4437).
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 6 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Felder, Gallagher, Gentile, Lanza, Recchia and Oddo.

The following 2 Council Memvers voted to abstain: Council Members Avella and Vallone. Jr.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Denouncing The Border Protection, Anti-Terrorism, and illegal Immigration Control Act of 2005 (HR 4437).

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the Vehicle and Traffic Law so that non-police officers employed by state and municipal law enforcement agencies are mandated to wear safety belts while operating authorized emergency vehicles, and urging the New York City Police Commissioner to enforce the ban against unauthorized mobile telephone use by law enforcement personnel while operating authorized emergency vehicles.

Items.MatterName: Non-police officers employed by state and municipal law enforcement agencies are mandated to wear safety belts while operating authorized emergency vehicles.
